article:
'Thermal hydrolysis' is the process where waste or sludge is boiled under high
pressure and high temperature, between 160-180 degrees. Cells rich in energy
are released and the solution gives a doubling of the amount of biogas compared
to the traditional solutions. The biogas can be used to generate power and
heat. The process provides more energy than used in the hydrolysis, which
results in reduced costs of sewage pollution. The end product is disinfected,
i.e. germ-free.
